file.name: Problems_building_fabric.txt
file.title: Problems building fabric
file.preview:
When I try to build fabric using: make 'dist-clean all', in vagrant in the '/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$', I get the following output:
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-peer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-orderer | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-ccenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'
docker images -q hyperledger/fabric-javaenv | xargs -I '{}' docker rmi -f '{}'

text: <@U0PB67X4K|garisingh> commented on <@U2B4QU7U3|karnn>’s file <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/karnn/F3L3B2K7V/problems_building_fabric.txt|Problems building fabric>: looks like you have some type of network / DNS error.  Within Vagrant, what happens if you do `ping <http://index.docker.io|index.docker.io>`?

comment.comment: looks like you have some type of network / DNS error.  Within Vagrant, what happens if you do `ping <http://index.docker.io|index.docker.io>`?

text: <@U0PB67X4K> i get the following: ping: unknown host <http://index.docker.io|index.docker.io>
what about on your host OS outside of Vagrant?

text: <@U0PB67X4K> is this a problem with vagrant's port forwarding or with the dns server i'm connected to?
hmm - well looks like your host is connecting just fine so that's good news.   Unfortunately I am not an expert on Vagrant so not sure why DNS resolution is not working correctly
<@U0PB67X4K> should i just destroy and up again?
<@U0PB67X4K>  also quick question, the repo i clone from gerrit is the latest build right? the 0.6 release is something i need to clone manually right/
I'd go with the destroy approach.  And yes - by default you would clone the master branch which is the current working branch for the next release(s)
BTW - if you are working off the master branch, you don't actually need to use Vagrant anymore.  You just need to have Docker installed locally on your host system
For example, I use OSX and I run everything within OSX and don't use Vagrant at all
<@U0PB67X4K> i use rhel7.2. so i need to have docker and follow the same docs?

<@U0PB67X4K> quick question. is there a problem if i build "sudo make dist-clean all" in in the '/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric' folder. or should i make a new docker group and add user to that group so that i can connect to docker.
<@U0PB67X4K> nvm, i'll just make a docker group to be safe
I go with the docker group
